author: Chandra Philip
description: A majority of Canadians, including B.C. residents, say they support the idea of an Alberta-B.C. pipeline to the north coast, according to a recent survey. The survey by Angus Reid found that 59 percent of Canadians said they were in favour of a pipeline, while 26 percent said they were opposed to the idea. Fifteen […]
title: Majority of Canadians, Including BC Residents, Support Alberta-BC Pipeline: Survey

author: T.J. Muscaro
description: Lecornu resigned as prime minister on Oct. 6.
title: Macron Reappoints Lecornu as French Prime Minister

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: The oil pipeline proposal currently being developed by Alberta will need the backing of B.C.’s government and First Nations along the pipeline route for it to be built, federal Energy Minister Tim Hodgson says. Alberta announced Oct. 1 that it would take the lead in crafting a pipeline proposal, with expertise and input from industry […]
title: Energy Minister Says Alberta’s Pipeline Proposal Needs BC Support to Move Forward

author: Bill Pan
description: The committee said that its choice aligns with the prize's mission.

description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.

author: The Canadian Press
description: A 62-year-old Quebec man has been found guilty of second-degree murder in the killing of a 10-year-old girl in a Montreal suburb more than 31 years ago. Réal Courtemanche, already in prison for other crimes, today admitted that the evidence in the case proves beyond a reasonable doubt that he murdered Marie-Chantale Desjardins. The 10-year-old […]
title: Cold Case: Quebec Man Admits to Murdering 10-Year-Old Girl in 1994

author: Cory Morgan
description: Commentary Albertans were surprised when the Alberta Teachers’ Association (ATA) overwhelmingly rejected what appeared to be a reasonable offer and chose to go on strike. On the table was a 12 percent wage increase along with a commitment to hire 3,000 new teachers. It would have made Alberta’s teachers among the highest-paid in Western Canada. […]
title: Cory Morgan: As Alberta Teachers Strike, Students’ Interests Must Come Before Ideology

author: Matthew Horwood
description: U.S. tariffs on certain Canadian sectors will likely remain in place even with a re-negotiated United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) in 2026, Prime Minister Mark Carney says. Carney made the comments at an Oct. 10 press conference, saying approximately 85 percent of trade with the United States remains tariff-free, and “one of the possibilities” is that […]
title: Carney Says USMCA Renegotiation Unlikely to Resolve All Trade ‘Issues’

author: Jack Phillips
description: The Mountain Home Air Base in Elmore County, Idaho, will host Qatari F-15 fighter planes, the Pentagon chief said.
title: Hegseth Says US Will Host Qatari Air Force Facility and F-15 Fighter Jets in Idaho

author: Roslyn Kunin
description: Governments are pulling the plug on natural gas with no real backup plan in place and Canadians are paying the price.
title: Natural Gas Bans Are Fuelling Higher Energy Costs

author: The Canadian Press
description: British Columbia jails have been added to the growing list of sites behind picket lines as public service workers escalate job action. The BC General Employees’ Union says in a statement that all its remaining unionized staff at adult correctional facilities across the province are now on strike. The union says the escalation brings the […]
title: BC’s Public Service Workers Escalate Strike to Correctional Facilities

description: He hinted at new strategic systems and possible nuclear tests, as experts warn that the lapse of the last major arms pact could spark a new arms race.

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Health Canada has issued an expanded recall notice for ESR HaloLock wireless power blocks used for mobile phone charging after receiving reports the products caused fires in Canada and the United States. There have been nine reports of fires resulting in property damage in Canada and 11 in the United States as of Sept. 26, […]
title: Health Canada Expands Portable Charger Recall After Additional Fire Reports

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Harry Potter author J.K. Rowling is mocking Vancouver’s parks and recreation board after its commissioners unanimously voted to apologize for hosting a Harry Potter event that is set to open in the city next month. “To be honest, I didn’t even know Vancouver Parks and Recreations had avowed me, so the disavowal hasn’t been much […]
title: Vancouver Parks Board Apologizes for Harry Potter Event, JK Rowling Responds

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: The disparity in police-reported violent crime between Canada and the United States has decreased in recent years, largely due to an uptick in major assaults recorded north of the border. A Statistics Canada study examining crime trends from 1998 to 2023 found that the incidence of police-reported violent crimes for every 100,000 residents remains higher […]
title: Canada Sees Increase in Police-Reported Violent Crime as US Rates Fall

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney has announced three measures tackling affordability that will be included in the next federal budget. The prime minister said on Oct. 10 that his government will aim to make it easier to file taxes and receive benefits, make the national school food program permanent, and extend the Canada Strong Pass for […]
title: Carney Makes Pre-Budget Announcement on Automatic Tax Filing, School Food Program, Parks Pass

author: The Canadian Press
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney has asked each of his cabinet ministers and secretaries of state to identify three to five “key objectives” that will help the Liberal government achieve its core missions. In a July 8 letter, Carney gave the ministers and secretaries less than three weeks to map out these priorities for action over […]
title: PM Carney Directed Ministers to Map out Their Objectives for Coming Year

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: The union representing striking Canada Post workers has announced a transition from a nationwide walkout to rotating strikes beginning Oct. 11, a decision that will partially restore the flow of mail and parcels. Rotating strikes are set to start on Oct. 11 at 6 a.m. local time, Canadian Union of Postal Workers (CUPW) National President […]
title: Canada Post Union Shifts to Rotating Strikes, Ending Countrywide Action

author: PA Media
description: The UK has signed a £350 million deal to supply the Indian Army with air defence missiles and launchers. The lightweight-multirole missiles will be made in Northern Ireland, securing more than 700 jobs, the Ministry of Defence said. The same type of weapon is already being manufactured for Ukraine at the Thales plant in east […]
title: UK Signs £350M Deal to Supply India With Air Defence Missiles and Launchers

author: PA Media
description: Foreign Secretary Yvette Cooper has affirmed the UK’s commitment to stability in the Western Balkans at a high-level summit in Northern Ireland. She welcomed foreign ministers from across the region, including North Macedonia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Serbia, Montenegro, Albania and Kosovo, as well as European allies such as France, Austria, Greece and Italy, to Hillsborough […]
title: Cooper Affirms UK’s Commitment to Stability in Western Balkans at Summit

author: PA Media
description: The waiting list for planned hospital treatment in England has increased for the third consecutive month, figures show. It comes as experts sounded the alarm that winter could be “very tough” for the health service. An estimated 7.41 million treatments were waiting to be carried out at the end of August, relating to 6.26 million […]
title: Waiting List for Planned Hospital Treatment Rises for Third Month in a Row

author: PA Media
description: Jewish people have stood in silence outside their synagogue to mark the moment a week ago when two of their community were murdered by an Islamist terrorist. Dozens of local Jews, some with arms linked or hugging, paid tribute to father-of-three Melvin Cravitz, 66, and Adrian Daulby, 53, the “quiet hero” who blocked the doors […]
title: Vigil Held at Manchester Synagogue One Week After Terror Attack

author: PA Media
description: An Afghan migrant who is accused of making a threat to kill Reform UK leader Nigel Farage in a TikTok post has opted not to give evidence in his trial. Fayaz Khan, 26, is charged with making a threat to kill the politician between October 12 and 15 last year in a video on the […]
title: Migrant Accused of Threatening to Kill Nigel Farage Opts Not to Give Evidence

author: The Associated Press
description: NEW YORK—A defamation lawsuit that Drake brought against Universal Music Group was tossed out Thursday by a federal judge who said the lyrics in Kendrick Lamar’s dis track “Not Like Us” were opinion. The feud between two of hip-hop’s biggest stars erupted in the spring of 2024, with the pair trading a series of vitriolic […]
title: Judge Tosses Out Drake’s Defamation Lawsuit Against Label Over Kendrick Lamar’s ‘Not Like Us’

author: The Associated Press
description: STOCKHOLM—Hungarian writer László Krasznahorkai won the Nobel Prize in literature on Thursday. The Nobel judges said the 71-year-old author, whose novels sometimes consist of just one long sentence, is “a great epic writer” whose work “is characterized by absurdism and grotesque excess.” He’s the first Nobel literature winner from Hungary since Imre Kertesz in 2002 […]
title: Hungarian Writer László Krasznahorkai Wins Nobel Prize in Literature

author: Reuters
description: MANILA—An earthquake of magnitude 7.6 struck offshore in the southern Philippines on Friday, the country’s seismology agency said, with tsunami warnings issued in several countries and people in nearby coastal areas urged to evacuate to higher ground. The Phivolcs agency warned of damage and aftershocks from the strong offshore quake, which struck in waters off […]
title: Strong 7.6 Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Off Southern Philippines, Tsunami Warning Issued

author: Jacob Burg
description: The troops will be tasked with monitoring the peace agreement in Israel while working with other international forces on the ground.
title: US to Assign 200 Troops to Gaza Task Force, But No Operations in Gaza: Officials

description: In a historic decision, the court found the company liable for inadequate protections and insufficient follow-up after the leak.

description: The trial of a former Hydro-Québec employee accused of economic espionage for Beijing began in a Quebec court on Oct. 9, after delays related to the utility’s request to keep certain corporate information confidential. author: Chandra Philip
description: Alberta’s teachers union says it will return to the bargaining table after teachers went on strike on Oct. 6 following a majority vote by teachers against a proposal by the province. The Alberta Teachers’ Association (ATA) said its members were looking for more to address classroom complexity and salary needs. Union president Jason Schilling previously […]
title: Alberta Teachers Union Says Will Return to Bargaining Talks Next Week

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Public Safety Minister Gary Anandasangaree appeared in committee to discuss his priorities in the fall sitting and was pressed by opposition MPs on issues like illegal migrants, recent church arsons, and the federal gun buyback program. Anandasangaree told MPs at an Oct. 9 public safety committee meeting that his top priorities are enhancing border security […]
title: Public Safety Minister Fields Questions on Illegal Migration, Church Arsons During Committee Meeting
